messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved?
ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved is an improved implementation of AnimateAnyone that allows users to generate stylized videos using opse image sequences and reference images.
What is the current goal of the ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved project?
The current goal of the project is to achieve the desired pose2video result with 1+FPS on GPUs that are equal to or better than RTX 3080.
Where can users find example workflows for using ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved?
Users can find example workflows for using ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved in the '_Example_Workflow' directory of the project.
Which samplers and schedulers are supported by ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved?
ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved supports different samplers and schedulers, including DDIM, DPM++ 2M Karras, LCM, Euler, Euler Ancestral, LMS, and PNDM.
Yes, ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved supports adding Lora, as demonstrated by the insertion of LCM Lora.
How long of pose image sequences can ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved handle?
ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved can handle 120+ frames pose image sequences with 'context_frames=24' on an RTX 3080 GPU.
From which project is the current implementation of ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved adopted?
The current implementation of ComfyUI-AnimateAnyone-Evolved is adopted from the Moore-AnimateAnyone project.
